info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:47PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell and northeastern Rutherford Counties through 530 PM EST... At 447 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Rutherfordton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutherfordton, Spindale, Shingle Hollow, Green Hill, Thermal City, Sunshine, Dysartsville, Union Mills and Fero. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for western and the Piedmont of North Carolina.
